head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #13

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #13 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy Hired Transport on her passage to Makinac in the month of September 1813[.]

First part of this 24 hours, little wind, foggy weather light showers or rain at intervals at ½ past 2 AM espied the land under our lee bow, which I suppose to be Bois blanc Island, immeadiately wear ship to the N:E to clear the East end of the Island, light airs at south, at ½ past 4 day light appears & the land seen to leeward proves to be Bois blanc, at 5 squally from the WSW handed the square sail & set the fore sail cl[…] close hauled larboard tacks aboard, close in with Bois blanc, at 6 took in the gallant sails blows fresh at times, in Sight of Makina fired 2 Guns & hoisted the colours at 8 starboard tacks aboard moderate breezes at West & clear weather at 10 freshens – at 1 PM blows a gale, single reefed the top sails – handed the fore sail, & hauled the flying jibb ½ boone in – at 3 close in with goose Island wore ship to the southwards at 4 clewed up the top sails with an intention of anchoring under Bois blanc sounded find 19 to 17 fathom close in with the land haul off again, wind abates, set whole top sails top gallant sails, flying jibb out to the boom and larbour tacks aboard – at 6 calm, at 8 starboard tacks aboard little wind from the NW & clear pleasant weather – makinac distant about 6 miles – latter part wind & weather the same[.]

First part of this 24 hours light breezes of wind from WSW & clear weather set the fore sail at 2 AM larboard tacks aboard at ½ past 3 close in with Makinac, starboard tacks aboard, at 8 AM came too in 3 fathom water with the best bower, handed all sail – at 2 PM hove up & towed in towards the wharff in 2½ fathom – latter part of the day cloudy & showery, at 8 wind Some lightening to the Westward – set the Watch – from 9 PM to day light an incessant shower of rain & Thunder with lightening, got the small bower ready for letting go[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
